Package Utils

Class Table<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utils.Table<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Table<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements a matrix data structure, i.e. an ArrayList of T[] arrays. It provides in particular various kinds of streams for iterating over the matrix. The rows in the matrix are always kept at equal length, if necessary by inserting null-elements.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • columnStream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<T[]> columnStream​(int[] colIndices)
        generates a stream of tuples which are extracted from different column positions in the rows The tuples are stored in a single little array. The array is reused for each new tuple.
        Parameters:
        colIndices - the different column positions
        Returns:
        the stream of tuples with values extracted from the column positions.

      • columnStream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<T[]> columnStream​(int[] colIndices,
                                                 int startInclusive,
                                                 int endExclusive)
        generates a sub-stream of tuples which are extracted from different column positions in the rows The tuples are stored in a single little array. The array is reused for each new tuple.
        Parameters:
        colIndices - the different column positions
        startInclusive - the start row index
        endExclusive - the end row index
        Returns:
        the stream of tuples with values extracted from the column positions.
